metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000371 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability,if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory isallocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will begrown down to 0x80000000, and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segmentand the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard pagecan be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 andCVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000371` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116~14.04.1
